item.title: The US has dropped out of the top 10 most powerful passports — but where does Australia rank?
item.description: The US passport has fallen to 12th place, a five-spot decline from its previous ranking, tying with Malaysia.

item.title: Powerhouse misses opportunity to get Melbourne-bound drums of Sydney's Midnight Oil
item.description: Midnight Oil are Sydney rock royalty, but the drum kit that stuck with the band for more than 40 years is heading to a Melbourne music museum.

item.title: CCC investigation into former Townsville mayor Troy Thompson finished, but unreleased
item.description: A crime and corruption investigation into former Townsville mayor Troy Thompson has been finished, weeks away from a by-election he is expected to contest.

item.title: Conjoined boys born in PNG bound for Australia for medical treatment
item.description: The boys, who are only the second known case of conjoined twins born in PNG, are expected to come to Australia for medical treatment.

item.title: Australian seamer Megan Schutt looks to delay retirement until 2026
item.description: Megan Schutt had once planned to walk away after the ODI Women's World Cup, but the veteran seamer is now considering playing into 2026 for Australia.

item.title: ARLC says NRL players face 10-year ban for joining rebel leagues
item.description: The Australian Rugby League Commission has announced a 10-year ban for any NRL player who agrees to join a football competition it does not recognise.

item.title: When is the F1 US Grand Prix, how can I watch and who is battling for the championship?
item.description: Formula 1 returns to the United States, officially marking the final quarter of an epic 2025 championship. Here is what is to come.

item.title: Hamas executes 'collaborators and lawbreakers' in graphic scenes in Gaza
item.description: Masked gunmen have carried out "extrajudicial executions" in the streets of Gaza City as an expert claims the terror group is trying to regain control of the destroyed enclave.

item.title: Michael J Fox talks about life with Parkinson's disease
item.description: The Back to the Future star has been candid about life with the degenerative neurological condition.

item.title: How long does it take to acclimatise to a new place when the weather is very different?
item.description: Do our bodies actually acclimatise when moving from one climate to another and can we do anything to smooth the transition?

item.title: Police charge two men after raids on alleged safe houses used by South-East Asian drug gang
item.description: Investigators are probing links between a haul of drugs seized on Tuesday and the South-East Asian gang allegedly behind a failed hit in Western Sydney last week.

item.title: SES critical of weather bureau, Eugowra flood inquest told
item.description: The third day of an inquest into two deaths during the 2022 Eugowra flood hears of concerns raised within the SES about the accuracy of weather bureau warnings.

item.title: Federal government puts states, territories on notice over failure to close the gap for Indigenous people
item.description: The federal Indigenous minister may impose penalties on states and territories that fail to meet critical targets for the National Agreement on Closing the Gap.

item.title: Donald Trump says Time magazine cover of himself may be 'worst' in history
item.description: Donald Trump made the comments in reference to Time magazine's upcoming November cover story, detailing how his administration "sealed the Gaza ceasefire deal".

item.title: Australia's baby recession deepens, new ABS data says
item.description: The baby recession in Australia is deepening as cost of living pressures make the decision for people to have children less of a choice.

item.title: Magistrate issues arrest warrant after teen refuses to attend court over alleged murders
item.description: A teenager in youth custody over the murders of Dau Akueng and Chol Achiek is forcibly arrested by police after he repeatedly refused to attend court.

item.title: NSW bowler Sean Abbott subbed out of Sheffield Shield game after splitting webbing on hand
item.description: Sean Abbott becomes the latest Test hopeful to suffer an injury, ruled out of NSW's Sheffield Shield match after splitting the webbing on his bowling hand.

item.title: David Pye faces murder trial accused of organising Nick Martin assassination at Kwinana Motorplex
item.description: The man accused of organising the assassination of former Rebels boss Nick Martin believed the bikie had also arranged to have him killed, a Perth court hears.

item.title: UK social media star 'Big John' Fisher being deported from Australia over visa issues
item.description: British social media star "Big John" says he is being deported from Australia after apparently failing to comply with visa requirements.

item.title: Three Australian men accused of killing Zivan Radmanovic in Bali could face death penalty
item.description: Indonesian police allege Zivan Radmanovic was killed when two Australian men stormed the villa, shooting him.

item.title: Boat approaches southern right whales off Albany coast in WA
item.description: The latest close encounter with a protected whale species has renewed calls for the public to give the animals space.

item.title: Police charge man with Armadale murder after alleged altercation leaves older man dead
item.description: Police charge a 35-year-old man with murder after the death of a 49-year-old man in the Perth suburb of Armadale.

item.title: Residents in WA's north urged to prepare for cyclone season
item.description: The Bureau of Meteorology says it will no longer publish a cyclone outlook for WA's north, saying it was less reliable due to a changing climate.

item.title: Wednesday finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Queensland government apologises for releasing victims of crime data which overstated drop in numbers
item.description: The Queensland government has apologised for releasing data that overstated a drop in the number of victims of crime.

item.title: CO2 emissions reached record high in 2024, World Meteorological Organization report finds
item.description: The World Meteorological Organization says carbon dioxide levels in the atmosphere are increasing at rates that have tripled since the 1960s, and emissions from human activities and more wildfires have helped fan a "vicious climate cycle."

item.title: Syria's president Sharaa tells Putin he will respect all past deals with Moscow
item.description: Syrian President Ahmed al-Sharaa has told Russian President Vladimir Putin he would honour all past deals struck between his country and Moscow, a pledge suggesting Moscow's two main military bases in Syria are safe.

item.title: Madagascar military coup leader Michael Randrianirina 'taking the position of president'
item.description: Colonel Michael Randrianirina led a rebellion by soldiers that ousted President Andry Rajoelina after weeks of youth-led protests against the government.

item.title: Australia sees opportunity in China-US rare earths dispute
item.description: Trump may have expressed "shock", but his administration is clearly not surprised at China's willingness to flex its dominance on rare earths.

item.title: Fresh new faces campaigning to make a difference in Melbourne's north as part of youth council
item.description: Melbourne's Hume Council will see the city's first-ever democratically elected youth mayor take office.

item.title: Calvary Health Care questioned over Launceston private hospital's future after infrastructure failure
item.description: Tasmanian healthcare experts are calling for assurances about the future of a private hospital in Launceston in the wake of a costly infrastructure failure.

item.title: Singapore, 'so dependent on external demand', braces for tariff hit
item.description: Businesses in Singapore — one of the most trade-exposed economies in the world — have been watching the fallout from Donald Trump's 'Liberation Day' tariffs with apprehension.

item.title: 'No understanding': The extreme cost of living crisis affecting Australia’s most remote communities
item.description: Being one of Australia’s most remote and disadvantaged communities, Aurukun’s grocery prices are some of the highest in the country.

item.title: Historic Number 12 Squadron returns as Australia expands anti-submarine capability
item.description: The federal government has re-established the Number 12 Squadron in SA at the same time as Australia's anti-submarine capability is expanding with the arrival of new aircraft.

item.title: AFL trade period quick hits: Zach Merrett's agent fumes, clubs feud over Callum Ah Chee deal and Charlie Curnow gets his move
item.description: The AFL trade period's deadline day delivered more drama than ever — with a manager blowing up and a Hawks star suggesting Essendon is 'Alcatraz' on a social media post.

item.title: US wants to make rare earth deals with Australia but without China involved, expert says
item.description: As rare earths re-emerge as a central battleground in the US-China trade war, Australian companies are already striking deals to supply America. A policy expert says talks at the White House next week could secure a national agreement.

item.title: Fifty years since the Balibo Five murders, families are still seeking justice
item.description: On the 50th anniversary of the Balibo Five murders, families are still grieving the loss of their loved ones and remain committed to holding those responsible accountable for their actions.

item.title: US vows to 'impose costs on Russia' if Ukraine war continues
item.description: Ukraine implements emergency power cuts across the country amid a relentless drone assault on the country's power grid.

item.title: Australians are no fans of Donald Trump, but see no alternative to US alliance, according to poll
item.description: New polling shows most Australians want to stick with the US alliance, despite holding overwhelmingly negative views towards the Trump administration and harbouring deep worries about the erosion of American democracy.

item.title: Queensland government 'confident' greyhound track The Q can meet animal welfare standards after review
item.description: An independent review was commissioned into a greyhound racing track near Brisbane after it was deemed unsafe earlier this year. There is pressure on the government to release it.

item.title: Dead koala found after sighting of the endangered animal halted ACT suburb's construction
item.description: The construction of new homes in Canberra's north remains on hold after a koala was spotted. Now, a dead koala has been found nearby.

item.title: What is Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder and how is it diagnosed? Unpacking questions about ADHD
item.description: October marks Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD) awareness month and the focus this year is on the many faces of the neurological condition.

item.title: Australians Ajla Tomljanović and James Duckworth reach WTA and ATP quarterfinals in Asia
item.description: Australian duo Ajla Tomljanović and James Duckworth reach the quarterfinals at their respective events in China and Kazakhstan.

item.title: Casterton residents still displaced one year on from 2024 hailstorm
item.description: A year since the freak hailstorm that devastated the Victorian town of Casterton, Kim Jeffrey marked the anniversary the same way she has spent most of 2025 — living in a caravan in her driveway.

item.title: Third day of renewed search for missing 4yo Gus wraps up amid extreme heat
item.description: More than 100 people, including from SA Police, the Australian Defence Force, and the State Emergency Services, have been walking about 20 kilometres per day in hot conditions during the renewed search, police say. The search concluded about midday on Thursday.

item.title: Bundaberg and Maryborough grapple with anti-social behaviour in town centres
item.description: Arriving at their local park for a morning walk, Lili Jacobsen was pulling her pram out of the car when a woman approached her, talking about the devil and demanding money.

item.title: Nikon Small World photomicroscopy competition's top 15 images of 2025 capture our tiniest signs of life
item.description: Extreme close-ups of rice weevil, pollen in a spider's web and a geometer moth laying eggs are among this year's Nikon Small World competition entries from thousands of scientists and artists across the globe. Here are the judges' favourites.

item.title: Soldier killed in vehicle rollover during army training in north Queensland
item.description: The Department of Defence says an Australian soldier has died after a single-vehicle rollover during training at the Australian Army's Townsville Field Training Area.

item.title: England saved by rain in Pakistan World Cup match as Australia prepares to face Bangladesh
item.description: Only a rain downpour against Pakistan prevents England from recording its first defeat of the World Cup, as Australia looks to book its berth in knockout stages.

item.title: Cost of 'best practice' on emissions at leaking Darwin gas plant an 'intolerable risk' for Santos
item.description: Santos's Darwin gas plant is set for a new lease of life despite a major methane leak. The company told federal officials the risk it could be forced to meet best practice on carbon emissions was "intolerable".

item.title: Replica of destroyed Juukan Gorge being built five years after Rio Tinto blast
item.description: A full-scale replica of the Juukan Gorge rock shelter, destroyed by mining company Rio Tinto, will be built over the remains of the original in Western Australia's north.

item.title: Inside the plan to rebuild Juukan Gorge rock shelter destroyed by Rio Tinto
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Teen girl allegedly fixated with Bondi and Columbine massacres granted bail
item.description: A knife-wielding Victorian teen allegedly fixated by the Columbine school shooting and Bondi Junction attack has been granted bail.

item.title: Prestigious Australian wine labels feeling the pinch as Chinese buy and drink less
item.description: Cheaper bulk wine has been struggling in the market, but now even prestigious labels like Penfolds are feeling the pinch off the back of changing drinking habits and a reported crackdown on lavish banquets for civil servants.

item.title: R360 hits back at Australian Rugby League Commission's threat of 10-year bans for rebel players
item.description: The boss of R360 says threats of 10-year bans for NRL players who defect to the rebel competition are predictable, as the code war escalates.

item.title: Pentagon journalists exit en masse over new reporting restrictions
item.description: Journalists working at the Pentagon had been asked to sign a pledge to refrain from reporting information not authorised for release by the US Department of War.

item.title: Why did Britain's case against two alleged Chinese spies collapse?
item.description: The collapse of the case against the men — a former think-tank director and a researcher for a senior MP — prompts some to argue the British government deliberately failed to provide enough evidence against the pair in order to avoid upsetting China.

item.title: Country GP crushed by vintage tractor in Denmark issues safety warning
item.description: What started as a routine day of chores for a country GP and his son became a life-or-death situation after he was crushed by a vintage tractor.

item.title: Four-time Olympic champion Ariarne Titmus announces retirement
item.description: Ariarne Titmus draws the curtain on a decorated career, in which she won eight medals across two Olympic Games.

item.title: Victorian Auditor-General lays out government's 'slow' and 'burdensome' response to 2022 floods
item.description: A Victorian Auditor-General's report says state government agencies need to be quicker at providing relief and recovery when responding to natural disasters.

item.title: Madura Plains sheep station hits the market as wool and lamb prices soar
item.description: One of Australia's largest sheep stations is listed for sale as wool and lamb prices soar.

item.title: Which team came out the most ahead in the AFL draft period and does free agency need fixing?
item.description: It was one of the more chaotic AFL trade periods on record as picks and players moved all over the place — but who came out ahead the most?

item.title: Police investigating reports of explicit deepfake images of girls from Sydney school
item.description: The ABC understands a number of families attended Eastwood Police Station on Wednesday evening after growing frustrated that a local high school had failed to act on a complaint.

item.title: Broken Hill man who ran 27 marathons in 29 days finishes with fractured hip
item.description: Mitch McKenny is unlikely to run again after spending four weeks running from Broken Hill to Newcastle, including the last 380 kilometres with severe pain in his hip.

item.title: Calls for federal oversight of Indigenous deaths in custody rejected in the NT
item.description: Three decades after the landmark Royal Commission into Aboriginal Deaths in Custody, the Northern Territory parliament rejects a motion proposing the federal government establish an independent oversight body.

item.title: Australia's unemployment rate jumps to 4.5pc
item.description: Australia's unemployment rate jumped to 4.5 per cent in September, up from 4.3 per cent in August.

item.title: Kingston residents rally to save 130yo oak tree from transmission project
item.description: Residents are getting creative in their fight to save a "magnificent" 130-year-old Algerian oak tree from being felled for a controversial transmission line project in western Victoria.

item.title: Female shearer sets world record by shearing 500 merino lambs in one day
item.description: Nikki Lyons's clippers started humming at 6am. Twelve hours later, she was a world record holder.

item.title: Remains of missing Victorian woman Lucinda Miller discovered in police search
item.description: New information from a member of the local community has led police to human remains in bushland in Victoria's east believed to be missing woman Lucinda Miller.

item.title: Ariarne Titmus's retirement ends years of sacrifice and allows her to at last savour her greatness
item.description: Ariarne Titmus has given her life to a dream. As she sets off on her next adventures, she can be in no doubt that her years of sacrifice and devotion were worth it.

item.title: Consumer groups, regulator concern as number of Australians accessing super to fix health surges again
item.description: Australians were allowed to withdraw $1.37 billion from their superannuation accounts for medical costs last financial year, in another jump from previous years.

item.title: First Nations artists warn against AI 'double colonisation' as Meta uses work for training
item.description: The rapid development of AI is testing the effectiveness of the Copyright Act, with creative and media industries calling for better protections.

item.title: Trump confirms the CIA is conducting covert operations inside Venezuela
item.description: Donald Trump says he authorised the CIA operation in part to stop the flow of "drugs coming in from Venezuela".

item.title: Endangered regent honeyeaters released in Hunter breeding effort
item.description: Dozens of regent honeyeaters have been released in woodlands in the NSW Hunter Valley in an effort to boost the critically endangered population.

item.title: Melbourne drug trafficker Justin Craig Barnett jailed over foiled canola oil methamphetamine plot
item.description: A drug trafficker's dreams of a multi-million dollar payday — and a Lamborghini — collapsed after police uncovered liquid methamphetamine in canola oil bottles.

item.title: Mother who faked son's cancer diagnosis pleads guilty to 11 charges
item.description: A South Australian woman has pleaded guilty to 11 charges after she faked her six-year-old son's cancer diagnosis in a bid to raise more than $11,000.

item.title: Hope at last for families as NSW backs inquiry into unsolved murders
item.description: The NSW Parliament has backed an inquiry into decades of unsolved murders and missing persons cases, following a campaign led by Illawarra families.

item.title: Assassin who killed Nick Martin at Kwinana Motorplex takes stand in David Pye murder trial
item.description: The man accused of orchestrating the murder of a Perth bikie boss at a suburban speedway did so because of tensions arising from his defection to a rival gang, a court has heard.

item.title: Madagascar's president Andry Rajoelina rose to power off youth discontent and was taken down by it
item.description: Former DJ Andry Rajoelina was the world's youngest head of state when he came to power in Madagascar in a 2009 coup. The military and youth movement were pivotal in his rise — and fall.

item.title: Curators among 45 full-time jobs to be axed in Art Gallery of NSW cuts
item.description: Leaked documents show curators and conservator jobs will go as 45 full-time roles are cut from the Art Gallery of NSW.

item.title: Review: After the Hunt has noble ambitions but misses the mark
item.description: The ingredients are all here — public scandal, duelling divas and unearthed secrets — but Luca Guadagnino's provocative drama misses the mark.

item.title: Albanese dismisses lobby concerns, Chalmers takes one for the team
item.description: This week, the PM was not wasting any time on "this" issue, and the treasurer took one for the team as Brett Worthington signs off with his final political wrap.

item.title: Coroner expresses 'horror' at lack of infrastructure upgrades after 2022 Eugowra flood
item.description: A coroner has expressed "horror" at the lack of modern river gauge infrastructure around the NSW inland community of Eugowra three years after it was smashed by record-breaking floods.

item.title: WA police minister defends digital firearms portal after inquiry found implementation was 'flawed'
item.description: The findings of an inquiry into WA's Firearms Act 2024 admitted to issues with a digital portal and a lack of "effective communication".

item.title: Queensland government approves Arrow Energy gas plant
item.description: The Queensland government's recent approval of a major coal seam gas-processing facility three kilometres from a farming family's home has left them feeling "extremely disappointed".

item.title: Former Ballarat dentist Ian Lomax suspended after alleged Neo-Nazi ties
item.description: Dental board suspends practitioner, who was allegedly photographed at a Neo-Nazi rally, while it investigates.

item.title: Essendon CEO says Hawthorn AFL trade tactics for Zach Merrett were surprising
item.description: Essendon chief executive Craig Vozzo says the club was surprised Hawthorn waited until late in the AFL trade period to make an offer for their captain, Zach Merrett.

item.title: The Hobart Clinic rescue hinges on Monday shareholder meeting
item.description: Despite the offer of a $2 million lifeline to keep a private mental health clinic in Hobart open, last-minute wobbles could yet scupper the rescue bid, as the clinic's shareholders prepare to meet on Monday.

item.title: Mark Haines inquest hears differing opinions from detectives on teen's mysterious death
item.description: Thirty seven years after his death, police still cannot agree on how 17-year-old Mark Haines came to be found on train tracks near Tamworth.

item.title: Siver Ferns coaching saga casts shadow over Constellation Cup opener against Diamonds
item.description: Imploring New Zealand Netball to reinstate coach Noeline Taurua, Silver Ferns skipper Karin Burger believes her team can put the turmoil aside when they face Australia in the Constellation Cup opener.

item.title: Inquiry into Queensland container refund scheme makes referrals to Crime and Corruption Commission
item.description: A parliamentary inquiry into the container refund scheme says it received "troubling evidence," including alleged conflicts of interest and unfair contracts, as well as bullying and harassment.

item.title: Teddy Swims tells SXSW Sydney he uses AI when making music, but warns of its dangers
item.description: Grammy-nominated music artist Teddy Swims says AI is a "beautiful tool" when it comes to composing music. Swims was in conversation at SXSW Sydney.

item.title: Essential workers cannot afford to rent in Western Australia, report finds
item.description: A new report shows there are just 16 affordable properties across the state for hospitality and childcare workers. It gets far worse if you live in a regional area.

item.title: Man charged with manslaughter over St James sudden death in Perth's south east
item.description: Homicide squad detectives charge a 33-year-old man with manslaughter over the sudden death of a 25-year-old man in Perth's south-east.

item.title: Diabetes-related condition cause of Emma Bates' death, court hears
item.description: A medical expert has told a court hearing for a man charged with negligent manslaughter that a 49-year-old woman died from a diabetes-related condition.

item.title: Darling Downs man found guilty of manslaughter of Russell Klein on Christmas Day
item.description: A jury finds Callum Anthony Padaric Cook guilty of the manslaughter of Russell Klein, who died after he was struck by Cook's car outside his home on Christmas Day in 2022.

item.title: Marnus Labuschagne improves Ashes Test case with another century for Queensland
item.description: Marnus Labuschagne has added to his case for selection in Australia's Test team for the Ashes, making an emphatic case for selection with his fourth century in five innings for Queensland.

item.title: Diane Keaton's family releases cause of death, urging tributes to homelessness services and animal shelters
item.description: The actor's family says the 79-year-old died of pneumonia, expressing gratitude for the "extraordinary messages of love and support" received following news of her passing.

item.title: Release of Virginia Giuffre's memoir renews sex allegations against Prince Andrew
item.description: Extracts from Virginia Giuffre's posthumously released memoir have further intensified the recently renewed scrutiny on Prince Andrew.

item.title: Cohealth's closure of three Melbourne GP clinics to affect 12,500 patients
item.description: Inner-city Melbourne community health service cohealth will be shuttering its GP services at the end of the year, citing escalating costs and aging infrastructure.

item.title: Thursday finance with Daniel Ziffer
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: National Gallery will host APY artwork exhibition after paintings cleared of improper interference
item.description: The National Gallery will host an exhibition of art from the Aṉangu Pitjantjatjara Yankunytjatjara Lands three years after a video appearing to show a non-Aboriginal assistant helping to paint an artwork led to it being postponed.

item.title: Tasma Walton and Robbie Arnott share $100,000 ARA Historical Novel Prize
item.description: Robbie Arnott's Dusk about twins hunting a puma in Tasmania, and Tasma Walton's I Am Nannertgarrook about an Aboriginal woman kidnapped and sold into slavery, have tied to win the ARA Historical Novel Prize.

item.title: Rugby Championship scrapped for 2026 due to Test calendar squeeze
item.description: The competition will not be played next year but will appear on the global calendar the following three years, including ahead of the 2027 Rugby World Cup, the organisers say.

item.title: Alyssa Healy scores second straight century as Australia qualifies for World Cup semis
item.description: Australian captain Alyssa Healy scores her second straight century as her side maintains its unbeaten record at the cricket World Cup with a 10-wicket win over Bangladesh.

item.title: Female shearer sets world record by shearing 500 merino lambs in one day
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Government unveils a plan to combat South Australian algal bloom
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: French PM Sebastien Lecornu survives no-confidence votes
item.description: Despite the reprieve, the motions underscore the fragility of President Emmanuel Macron's administration midway through his final term.

item.title: Donald Trump says Narendra Modi has pledged that India will stop buying Russian oil
item.description: The US president says his Indian counterpart has made the pledge, as pressure continues to mount over the purchases that fund Moscow's war in Ukraine.

item.title: Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin to discuss Ukraine war at Budapest summit
item.description: Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin will meet face-to-face in Hungary to discuss ending Russia's full-scale invasion of Ukraine, the US president announces.

item.title: Calls for Australia to follow England's ban on supermarket junk food specials
item.description: Research finding supermarkets continue to offer discounts and multi-buy deals on junk food more frequently than healthy food prompts calls for Australia to follow England's lead and ban "buy one, get one free" deals.

item.title: Palestinian journalist Shadi Abu Sido reunites with his family
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: More Palestinian prisoners allege mistreatment in Israeli prison system after being reunited with their families
item.description: Shadi Abu Sido spent 18 months in Israeli detention believing that his entire family had been killed in Gaza. Then he was reunited with his wife and children in Gaza.

item.title: Temperatures across Australia to soar, threatening October records
item.description: Unseasonable temperatures have lasted along the eastern seaboard for weeks — which has Sydney, and possibly Brisbane, on track to observe their warmest October on record.

item.title: WWII shipwrecks a 'ticking time bomb' for Federated States of Micronesia
item.description: The Federated States of Micronesia's biggest tourism asset has become one of its largest threats, with as much as 22 million litres of oil from World War II shipwrecks slowly leaking into the ocean.

item.title: Oil leaking from WW2 shipwreck the Rio de Janeiro Maru in Chuuk
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: 'Dangerously low' funding to Tasmanian arts sector creating reputational damage, minister warned
item.description: "Dangerously low" arts sector funding has rendered the Tasmanian industry "highly vulnerable", with funding stagnant since 2016-17, the state government has conceded.

item.title: Jim Chalmers and Tony Burke are in a long race for prime position
item.description: There is general agreement in Labor that Jim Chalmers is the government's best communicator. But insiders watching this race know Tony Burke is the master tactician.

item.title: Expanded search for Gus ends as missing persons advocate speaks out
item.description: SA Police and ADF personnel have concluded a four-day renewed search for four-year-old Gus, as a missing persons advocate speaks out about the emotional impact of such cases on all families who have experienced the disappearance of a loved one.

item.title: Drunken motorcyclist crashes with daughter riding as passenger
item.description: A Mildura father-of-six avoids jail after drunkenly crashing his motorbike while carrying his young daughter as a passenger.

item.title: Warnings for explicit deepfakes, 'image-based abuse' amid rise of AI technology
item.description: A senior academic has warned a Sydney school caught up in an investigation into digitally altered explicit images of female students is just "another shocking iteration" of gendered violence.

item.title: ASX slips as gold price surges to new record above $US4,300 — as it happened
item.description: The Australian share market falls after a downbeat session on Wall Street, weighed down by a sell-off across US regional bank stocks. Gold jumped to a new record high, above $US4,300 an ounce, as investors flocked to safe haven assets amid US-China trade tensions.

item.title: BHP vs China Inc: What the iron ore dispute says about Australia's present and future
item.description: The resolution of negotiations between Australian mining giant BHP and China's state-backed iron ore buyer China Mineral Resources Group could reshape not just the resources industry, but also international trade flows, global markets, and the relationship between China and the West.

item.title: Lucy Derbyshire hunting first Coolangatta Gold win, enters Iron Series as defending champion
item.description: Lucy Derbyshire enters this year's Iron Series as the defending champion and has set her sights on winning the Coolangatta Gold for the first time.

item.title: From cult web series to cinema: Nirvanna the Band the Show the Movie
item.description: Canada's cult web series heads to the big screen, after creators Matt Johnson and Jay McCarrol were told they could make any movie they liked after their success with BlackBerry.

item.title: Zach Merrett trade drama a reminder that deals can no longer be judged by amount of first-round picks involved
item.description: The AFL trade period offered three different test cases on just how much value a first-round pick holds during negotiations. Two stars got their moves, while one was left stranded.

item.title: New research shows impact of lead poisoning on ancient humans
item.description: A new study claims lead might be the reason why Homo sapiens came to dominate the world.

item.title: Minjee Lee and defending champion Hannah Green off to slow start in BMW Ladies Championship
item.description: Australia's golf aces are left needing to play catch-up as a hometown hero sets the pace to begin the BMW Ladies Championship in South Korea.

item.title: Dangerous flammable cladding still not removed from dozens of NSW high-rise apartment buildings
item.description: Dozens of high-rise apartment buildings across the state are still covered in flammable cladding as the NSW government's scheme has failed to fix them on schedule.

item.title: Shocking CCTV footage shows moment bus driver assaulted while driving down Darwin highway
item.description: Shocking video footage capturing the moment a bus driver was assaulted, and passengers were thrown through the air, has been played in the NT Supreme Court after the attacker pleaded guilty.

item.title: Specialist health services shortfall for women in regional WA leave many struggling for support
item.description: Faced with a lack of specialist women's health services, women in regional WA are researching their own conditions and volunteering to raise awareness.

item.title: How a 15yo autistic boy tinkering in his bedroom triggered WA's biggest ever data breach
item.description: Joshua's "passion project" with a radio scanner led to one of WA's most significant public health data breaches. His story highlights the challenges confronting autistic people caught up in the legal system.

item.title: Former Trump national security adviser John Bolton indicted
item.description: Donald Trump's former national security adviser John Bolton has been charged with mishandling classified information.

item.title: Younger candidates out to bring change in WA local government elections
item.description: In the last local government elections in WA, the average age of candidates running for councils was 53 years old — but these young candidates are keen to lower that figure.

item.title: Queensland government seeks private market interest to develop riverside precinct in South Brisbane
item.description: The government says construction could begin from March 2027 and has suggested the site could feature over 4,000 homes, as well as "event lawns" and promenades.

item.title: NicheLiving customers continue to find defects
item.description: Nicheliving customer Kathy Ellis thought her three-year nightmare was finally over in July, only to discover defective plumbing work in her new house.

item.title: McLaren's 'papaya rules' may be over as Oscar Piastri and Lando Norris battle for the F1 drivers' championship
item.description: "Papaya rules" have dominated Formula 1 for two seasons, but with both McLaren drivers in the heat of a world championship battle, Oscar Piastri and Lando Norris may no longer prioritise what is best for the team.

item.title: Starmer criticises police decision to ban fans of Israel's Maccabi Tel Aviv from Aston Villa match
item.description: Fans of Israel's Maccabi Tel Aviv are banned from attending next month's Europa League match against Aston Villa in Birmingham over "public safety concerns".

item.title: Woman stabbed in Melbourne's CBD in broad daylight
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Stabbing attack in Melbourne's CBD more evidence Victoria is nation's crime capital, opposition says
item.description: CCTV footage has emerged showing a random stabbing attack in Melbourne's CBD earlier this month. The Victorian opposition says its more evidence of Victoria's standing as the country's 'crime capital.'

item.title: Coronado Curragh fined for death of miner Clark Peadon
item.description: The MEU has described the fine as "inadequate" for the loss of someone's life.

item.title: Ace Frehley, founding member of rock group KISS, dies at 74
item.description: The original lead guitarist of the glam rock band captivated audiences with his elaborate makeup and smoke-filled guitar.

item.title: King Charles marks land rights milestone in first visit to London's Australia House
item.description: King Charles marked the major milestone in Aboriginal land rights alongside Uluru-Kata Tjuta's traditional owners.

item.title: Australian swimming star Ariarne Titmus says she lost 'fire in the belly' before shock retirement call
item.description: Ariarne Titmus has spoken publicly for the first time after abruptly retiring from professional swimming at just 25, revealing the reasons behind her decision.

item.title: SA Education Department fined after teen fell from school playground swing
item.description: South Australia's Education Department has been fined $225,000 after a student at a special school fell from a swing which had not had a comprehensive safety inspection for eight years.

item.title: Defence in talks to support Gaza peace plan but Australia says no request yet
item.description: Australia's defence force has had discussions with the Unted States to provide support for its Gaza peace plan but the government says no formal request has been made yet.

item.title: Virtual emergency department a lifeline for patients in regional areas
item.description: A virtual emergency room app created during the pandemic could help bridge healthcare gaps in regional Victoria. But more patients need to dial-in and use the resource.

item.title: How wild bird poo testing in northern Australia is helping keep eggs on the shelves
item.description: Hundreds of kilometres from the nearest supermarket, Indigenous rangers in Australia's remote north are working to keep eggs on your breakfast table.

item.title: Five people taken to hospital after chemical leak at Australia Post offices in Queensland
item.description: Authorities are working to identify the chemical that leaked from a single package at two post offices in Queensland. Four people of the people who were taken to hospital earlier have now been discharged.

item.title: Indigiearth founder inspires Indigenous women to chase business dreams
item.description: Sharon Winsor is honoured for her pioneering work in native Australian cuisine.

item.title: Bears kill record number of people in Japan amid scores of attacks
item.description: At least seven people have been killed by bears in the country since April and many more have been injured as the hungry animals venture into human territory to find food.

item.title: US dangled threat of Tomahawks for Ukraine, then Russia called to negotiate
item.description: US President Donald Trump threatened to send Tomahawk missiles to Ukraine if Russia did not return to peace talks, but analysts say the long-range weapons are not the game-changer they are made out to be.

item.title: Renters despair in 'landlord's market' where no-grounds evictions and frequent rent rises are legal
item.description: Renters and experts are calling for change in one of just two Australian jurisdictions where renters can be evicted for no reason and the only place where landlords can raise rents more than once a year.

item.title: Venezuela says US strike on suspected drug vessel 'extrajudicial executions'
item.description: A US strike against a suspected Venezuelan drug-smuggling vessel has left multiple survivors, as Venezuela's ambassador to the United Nations condemned the strikes as a "series of assassinations".

item.title: King Charles commemorates 40th anniversary of Uluru-Kata Tjuta handover
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: 'No doubt' Anthony Albanese and Donald Trump will discuss critical minerals: Chalmers
item.description: Anthony Albanese will "no doubt" use a meeting with Donald Trump next week to discuss critical minerals, the treasurer says as he dismisses a call for Australia to "decouple" with China over rare earth materials.

item.title: Hamish McIntyre elected new president of National Farmers' Federation
item.description: Hamish McIntyre is named the new president of Australia's peak farmer representative body.

item.title: Police renew appeal for information as 'inconsistencies' identified in 2022 death of toddler in Burpengary
item.description: Detectives are renewing calls for witnesses as they investigate the suspicious death of a 16-month-old boy in Burpengary in 2022.

item.title: Pacific Championships set to start without Australia as strong Samoa and Tonga teams take on New Zealand
item.description: Emerging superpowers Samoa and Tonga will field formidable teams loaded with NRL talent in the third edition of the Pacific Championships.

item.title: Missing man Troy Milne found alive in bushland more than two hours from campsite
item.description: A man who was missing in Victoria's east for more than a week is recovering in hospital after being found in bushland when he started a fire to draw attention to his location.

item.title: Broken Hill man wins appeal of sentence for animal cruelty offences
item.description: Jet Jai Johnson is released from prison two-and-a-half months into his 14-month sentence after telling a court spending his 21st birthday behind bars was a wake-up call.

item.title: WA's insolvent Griffin Coal ramps up operations as taxpayer bailout deadline looms
item.description: The receiver of a WA coal mine says it is ramping up operations in a final attempt to trade out of insolvency before millions of dollars in taxpayer support dries up.

item.title: Pet-friendly flights are taking off in Australia. Here's what to know
item.description: The first pet-friendly commercial flights have taken off in Australia this week. Here's what you need to know about the new service.

item.title: Victims of former Hobart teacher Keith Athol Bates-Willie read impact statements of abuse to court
item.description: After former teacher Keith Athol Bates-Willie was found guilty of assault against Hobart schoolboys, 10 complainants read out in court their victim impact statements as sentencing begins.

item.title: Cameron Green ruled out of Australia vs India ODI series, Marnus Labuschagne called into squad
item.description: Cameron Green has been ruled out of Australia's ODI series against India, just over a month out from the start of the Ashes series against England.

item.title: Family of murdered Darwin man Tony Rowe describe 'massive hole' of father's absence
item.description: Family members of Tony Rowe — who was murdered on the outskirts of Darwin in 2022 — have read emotional victim impact statements to the court ahead of killer Timothy Hunt's sentencing.

item.title: NT government's anti-discrimination law changes to 'restore' free speech pass parliament
item.description: Northern Territory Attorney-General Marie-Clare Boothby says the changes will protect freedom of expression and religion while retaining protections against hate speech.

item.title: Australia Test batter Nic Maddinson reveals testicular cancer diagnosis
item.description: Former Australia batter Nic Maddinson has revealed he underwent chemotherapy for testicular cancer.

item.title: What has John Bolton, former Trump adviser, been charged with and what happens now?
item.description: Donald Trump's former national security adviser has been charged with storing top secret records at home and sharing classified information. Here's what we know.

item.title: David Pye on bail after being refused anxiety drugs in custody, Nick Martin trial hears
item.description: An accused murderer and bikie gang member on trial in WA's Supreme Court amid heightened security is granted bail because he is unable to get access to anti-anxiety medication behind bars, it is revealed.

item.title: Donald Trump's plan to leave his mark on Washington DC by building Paris-style arch
item.description: The arch would stand at the Washington end of Memorial Bridge, which spans the Potomac River from Arlington, Virginia.

item.title: Ways to increase safety on a first date and red flags to watch for
item.description: Both people involved in a date are responsible for creating a safe environment, experts say.

item.title: Europe unveils plans for 'drone wall' to shield continent from Russian threats
item.description: The European Commission unveils plans for its so-called "drone wall", which is part of a range of initiatives to get the continent ready to defend itself by 2030.

item.title: Accused killer Jason Thomas King takes stand in Molendinar landlord Susan Walker's murder trial
item.description: Jason Thomas King has pleaded not guilty to the murder of his landlord Susan Walker on the Gold Coast in 2022.

item.title: Endemic frog and gecko species identified on Dauan Island in Torres Strait
item.description: Two new frog species and a banded-patterned gecko are believed to have sheltered among the boulders of Dauan, in the Torres Strait, for millions of years.

item.title: WA farmers and caravaners defend Australia's growing love affair with US-style utes
item.description: As American-style utes gain popularity across the country, there are calls for owners to face higher taxes for their "big cars, causing big problems".

item.title: Inquest hears of grief, trauma from families of Eugowra locals after record-breaking 2022 flood
item.description: Families speak of loss, trauma on final day of the coronial inquest into the deaths of Les Vugec and Diane Smith.

item.title: Jury finds Za'id Abdus Samad guilty of stabbing murder of uncle outside Brisbane home
item.description: A jury deliberated for one day before finding Za'id Abdus Samad guilty of the stabbing murder of his uncle in a "planned, vicious ambush" in 2017.

item.title: After three trials Hunter Valley man jailed for covering up Carly McBride's 2014 murder
item.description: Hunter Valley man James Anthony Cunneen has been sentenced to six years jail for covering up a murder after helping his friend to dump a woman's body.

item.title: NT DPP confirms it will not appeal sentence for Alice Springs baby assault
item.description: The NT Director of Public Prosecutions has confirmed it will not appeal the non-custodial sentence handed to a young man who fractured the skull of a nine-week-old baby in Alice Springs.

item.title: Video of attempted strip search that breached Aboriginal woman's human rights made public
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Video released of moments leading up to strip search that breached Aboriginal woman's human rights
item.description: The ACT Supreme Court has made public confronting video showing the moments leading up to a strip search that violated an Aboriginal woman’s human rights.

item.title: Three teens charged over Wakeley church attack on bishop hit with violent extremist material charges
item.description: Three of the five young people charged in relation to the alleged stabbing of a Bishop at a church in Sydney's west last year have been charged with additional offences.

item.title: Wayne Swan steps down as Labor president urging party to focus on membership boost
item.description: Labor party president Wayne Swan will step down next July and has warned the ALP must boost membership if it is to survive into the future.

item.title: Wittenoom asbestos contamination prompts legal threat from Banjima traditional owners
item.description: After decades of disconnection, the traditional owners of Wittenoom say they are prepared to take legal action to ensure the area is properly remediated so they can return to country.

item.title: Deepfake image-based abuse happening at least once a week in schools, eSafety data shows
item.description: The latest data revealed by Australia's eSafety Commissioner comes just days after reports that digitally altered explicit images of female students from a Sydney high school were shared online.

item.title: Friday the pelican captured and washed after three-week chase
item.description: Friday the pelican evaded capture for weeks. But a long-overdue bath is for her own good.

item.title: Grimmer family sets parliamentary privilege deadline for cold case identity
item.description: A brother of three-year-old Cheryl Grimmer, who vanished in 1970, has given the man who confessed to her killing a deadline to come forward or be named.

item.title: Strict conditions imposed on future LIV Golf site at North Adelaide
item.description: South Australia's Aboriginal affairs minister has imposed 31 strict conditions on the government's planned redevelopment of the North Adelaide golf course.

item.title: Minjee Lee shoots six-under second round at LPGA BMW Ladies Championship
item.description: In-form Minjee Lee has made a big move, powering once again into contention for a 12th LPGA Tour title.

item.title: Chinese national charged with foreign interference granted bail despite concerns she could flee country
item.description: A woman accused of covertly gathering information for the Chinese government has been granted bail in Canberra, despite police warning she could try to flee the country.

item.title: Scott Boland bowls Victoria to Sheffield Shield victory over NSW, ahead of Ashes against England
item.description: Scott Boland has produced a man-of-the-match performance, bowling Victoria to a 38-run win over New South Wales in their Sheffield Shield clash.

item.title: Former Japanese prime minister Tomiichi Murayama, famous for WWII apology, dies aged 101
item.description: Known for his landmark apology for Japan's World War II aggression and the phrases "deep remorse" and "heartfelt apology", Tomiichi Murayama has died at a hospital in Oita City.

item.title: Family of woman murdered by co-worker at National Zoo tell court of their 'constant grief'
item.description: Jude Wijesinghe previously pleaded guilty to stabbing his co-worker Tshewang Choden to death in the kitchen area of the National Zoo and Aquarium in Canberra, where they both worked, in 2023.

item.title: Phillip Island lap record smashed by Marco Bezzecchi in MotoGP practice
item.description: In a stunning performance in perfect conditions on Friday, Marco Bezzecchi became the first MotoGP rider to go under 1.27 at the regional Victorian track.

item.title: Madagascar military leader Michael Randrianirina sworn in as president after coup
item.description: An army colonel who seized power in a military coup has been sworn in as Madagascar's new leader, after a sudden power grab that ousted the president and sent him fleeing from the country.

item.title: Inquest recommends road safety reforms after cyclist killed by partially blind driver
item.description: A coroner has recommended changes to national driving fitness standards following the death of cyclist Robert Hill who was hit and killed by a partially blind driver on a country highway seven years ago.

item.title: David Crisafulli makes comment about 'not getting stabbed'
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Premier David Crisafulli apologises for 'poor choice' comment about Melbourne stabbing attack
item.description: David Crisafulli apologises for a remark about crime, made on the same day footage emerges of a random stabbing attack in Melbourne's CBD.

item.title: Australian Diamonds defeat New Zealand Silver Ferns 69-52 in game one of Constellation Cup
item.description: Australia has stormed to a commanding win in the first Test of the Constellation Cup series, defeating New Zealand 69-52.
